text: hello and welcome to community chats i'm
your host ali hama and today we're
interviewing nari kim
the early careers program manager here
at aws
nari thank you so much for being here
today you do such an incredible job at
aws leading our intern program
and one thing i'm always asked about is
how students can get an internship at
amazon
so can you tell us a little bit about
the process and how someone can score
that
internship thanks so much for having me
ellie uh our internships run from
december to february for students who
are in the penultimate year and the best
way that you can apply
is to look on linkedin your university
job boards or even our amazon job page
as well
where we will advertise for that open
internship program
at the moment if when you do apply for
an internship you may be asked to do an
online assessment followed by
a few interviews and there could also be
a presentation a whiteboard session
or any other assessment related to the
type of internship that you're applying
for
applications do open in march and that
will go through to
about july so make sure you get in early
thank you so much nary and the next gen
program is such an exciting initiative
that's a great way for any penultimate
students to gain that
industry experience hands-on so can you
tell us a little bit more about the
program and specifically what kind of
opportunities do the interns have if
they do land that internship
not a problem the next gen internship
was initially created
to feed into a lot of non-technical
roles i get asked a lot
from students how they can apply for
amazon or aws without a technical degree
and that's specifically why we created
the next gen internship so even if you
come from a background that's in
commerce or
arts communications anything we do have
opportunities for you too
so the next gen internship you will be
working within a non-technical team
whether it's in sales
business development sales and
operations strategy
or channel partner and alliances and you
do get to work on an individual project
that you'll be expected to deliver on at
the end of the internship
but aside from non-technical roles we
also do have a lot of technical
internship programs
for those who are interested in becoming
a solutions architect a tech trainer
a technical account manager or go into
our professional services
team but aside from the work you know we
also like to have a lot of fun here and
so you do get the opportunity to meet
with
very very smart individuals in the
industry and
find out more about amazon across all
the different verticals that we have
and while we have fun with a lot of
different social events
well i myself don't come from a
technical background so it's really
great to hear about how the program
supports all types of backgrounds
now for any prospective interns out
there who want to apply can you give us
any tips and tricks about
how they could ace that application
process
sure preparation is key you really have
to prepare well so make sure you've gone
through your cv cover to cover if
there's anything that the application
asks for like a written piece make sure
that you have that attached to your
resume as well
look into the amazon leadership
principles because that will come up
time and time again
and then also just prepare a couple
different very solid examples of
something that you're passionate about
or something you've taught yourself
recently
we understand with interns you're not
going to come from years and years of
experience so we just want to find out
more about you
and how you would fit in with our amazon
culture well i'm so glad that aws is
continuing to support this amazing
program and i
hope that so many of you out there
watching this will apply for the
internship
to finish off now where can students
look out for more information about the
next gen
intern program definitely so we will
post all of our open intern and graduate
opportunities on amazon.com
jobs and if you scroll down there is a
tab that says opportunities for students
and you'll be able to find everything
there
now thank you so much for coming on the
show i mean this is literally the most
asked about topic
that i've ever had so i hope uh all of
you watching it will find it really
useful if you have any questions please
pop them in the comments below
and we really appreciate your time see
you thank you so much ellie
bye
